criteria: Ability to write routinely over extended time frames for various tasks, purposes, and audiences, demonstrating research, reflection, and revision.
Capacity to write routinely within shorter time frames (single sitting or a day or two) for various tasks, purposes, and audiences.
Effectiveness in adapting writing style and content to suit different tasks, purposes, and audiences.
descriptions: The student does not write routinely or fails to engage in tasks requiring extended time frames, research, reflection, or revision.
The student attempts to write routinely but struggles to manage time effectively or incorporate research, reflection, or revision processes.
The student writes routinely for some tasks but shows limited engagement with research, reflection, or revision; purpose and audience are not always clear.
The student routinely writes over extended time frames, incorporating basic research, reflection, and revision for a limited range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.
The student writes routinely and effectively over extended time frames, demonstrating good research, reflection, and revision skills for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

The student excels at writing routinely over extended time frames, skillfully integrating research, reflection, and revision to produce high-quality work tailored to diverse tasks, purposes, and audiences.
The student does not write routinely within shorter time frames or struggles to complete tasks within the given timeframe.
The student attempts to write within shorter time frames but struggles with time management and producing coherent work.
The student writes within shorter time frames for some tasks, but the quality, purpose, or audience awareness is limited.
The student routinely writes within shorter time frames, demonstrating adequate coherence and awareness of purpose and audience for a limited range of tasks.
The student writes routinely and effectively within shorter time frames, showing good coherence and adaptation to purpose and audience across various tasks.
The student excels at writing routinely within shorter time frames, producing highly coherent and effective work that is finely tuned to its purpose and audience across a diverse range of tasks.
The student's writing shows no adaptation to different tasks, purposes, or audiences.
The student attempts to adapt writing but shows minimal understanding of how to tailor content or style.
The student adapts writing in a limited way, showing some awareness of task, purpose, or audience but lacking consistency.
The student demonstrates a basic understanding of adapting writing to different tasks, purposes, and audiences, with some successful adjustments in style and content.
The student effectively adapts writing style and content to suit different tasks, purposes, and audiences, showing a strong understanding of rhetorical strategies.
The student masterfully adapts writing to diverse tasks, purposes, and audiences, demonstrating sophisticated rhetorical skills and producing highly effective communication.
